conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway model with wall height/thickness and visible room volumes, but the camera is very close to a top-down orthographic view rather than an isometric/angled view.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion of walls with thickness and readable interior volumes; clean cutaway. Main weakness is the near top-down projection (limited side-face visibility and limited sense of elevation).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match well (central living/dining, kitchen at lower-left, bedrooms to right, bathrooms near top). Minor mismatches in exact partition lengths/door placements and some openings are simplified compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (beds, sofas, dining tables), kitchen counters/appliances and bathroom fixtures are represented; placement generally corresponds to the correct rooms with reasonable scale.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with good separation of walls/floors/furniture. Lighting is adequate; no UI/text contamination. Slight ambiguity from the near-orthographic camera.

detected_errors.description: Camera is very close to top-down orthographic, reducing multi-surface wall readability expected from an isometric cutaway.
Doors/windows are simplified; some door swing/orientation details and exact opening positions do not perfectly match the 2D plan.
Small proportional deviations in a few internal partitions/room extents versus the 2D drawing (layout broadly consistent but not dimension-faithful everywhere).

summary: A valid 3D cutaway with strong overall layout fidelity and interior content, slightly weakened by near top-down projection and minor wall/opening proportional mismatches.
